body_html:
uname -o "outputs GNU/Linux". I also found that cat /etc/slackware-version outputs "Slackware 14.0"

I also noted above that when manually running the Bazel commands, and replacing gcc with g++ it does seem to properly work. Is it possible to change the compiler that Bazel uses?
body_text:
uname -o "outputs GNU/Linux". I also found that cat /etc/slackware-version outputs "Slackware 14.0"
I also noted above that when manually running the Bazel commands, and replacing gcc with g++ it does seem to properly work. Is it possible to change the compiler that Bazel uses?
body: uname -o "outputs GNU/Linux". I also found that cat /etc/slackware-version outputs "Slackware 14.0" I also noted above that when manually running the Bazel commands, and replacing gcc with g++ it does seem to properly work. Is it possible to change the compiler that Bazel uses?
